contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Radio station | name = KUVO | image = | city = [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]], [[Colorado]] | area = [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]]-[[Boulder, Colorado|Boulder]], [[Colorado]] | slogan = Community, Culture, Music | branding = ''Jazz 89'' | frequency = 89.3 [[MHz]] {{HD Radio}} | repeater = | airdate = August 29, 1985 | format = [[Jazz]]/[[Public broadcasting|Public]] | erp = 22,500 [[watt]]s | haat = 278 meters | class = C1 | facility_id = [http://www.fcc.gov/fcc-bin/fmq?list=0&facid=16687 16687] | coordinates = {{coord|39|43|49|N|105|14|59|W|region:US_type:city|display=inline,title}} | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = | owner = [[Rocky Mountain PBS|Rocky Mountain Public Broadcasting Network, Inc.]] | licensee = | sister_stations = | webcast = [http://www.kuvo.org/index.php?s=23804 Listen Live] | website = [http://www.kuvo.org kuvo.org] | affiliations = [[National Public Radio|NPR]] }} '''KUVO''' (89.3 [[FM Broadcasting|FM]]) is an American [[radio station]] broadcasting mainly [[jazz]] music in a [[public broadcasting|public radio]] format. Licensed to [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]], [[Colorado]], KUVO began operations on August 29, 1985. The station's local programming consists primarily of [[jazz]], [[blues]], and [[latin jazz]] music, but it also includes programs devoted to other musical genres such as [[acid jazz]], [[funk]], [[gospel music|gospel]], [[rhythm and blues]], and [[salsa (music)|salsa]]. The station also carries selected [[National Public Radio|NPR]] and other syndicated programs such as: [[Marian McPartland]]'s ''[[Piano Jazz]]''; ''[[Riverwalk Jazz]]'', hosted by Jim Cullum; ''Jazz from Lincoln Center'', hosted by [[Wynton Marsalis]]; and [[Dee Dee Bridgewater]]'s ''Jazz Set''. The station has its own performance studio and will on occasion broadcast live performances and interviews by local and national recording artists. KUVO, which commonly refers to itself on-air as "The Oasis in the City", won the Major Market Jazz Station of the Year Award in 2005 and 2006 from JazzWeek Magazine. The station has been broadcasting from the Five Points Media Center at 2900 Welton Street in the [[Five Points, Denver|Five Points]] neighborhood of Denver since 1994.<ref>[http://www.kuvo.org/index.php?s=25140&item=19853 Location, location, location!] KUVO.org. Retrieved: 2012-02-28.</ref> Previously operated by Denver Educational Broadcasting, on January 16, 2013, it was announced that KUVO would merge into [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]] member network [[Rocky Mountain PBS]].<ref name=dp-merger>{{cite web|last=Ostrow|first=Joanne|title=RMPBS, KUVO and I-News merge, redefining Colorado public media|url=http://www.denverpost.com/entertainment/ci_22379630/rmpbs-kuvo-and-i-news-merge-redefining-colorado|publisher=[[Denver Post]]|accessdate=16 January 2013}}</ref> {{RadioTranslators | callsign = KUVO | call1 = K209ED | freq1 = 89.7 | fid1 = 121254 | city1 = Breckenridge, Colorado | call2 = K231BL | freq2 = 94.1 | fid2 = 36552 | city2 = Laramie, Wyoming | call3 = KVJZ | freq3 = 88.5 | fid3 = 89878 | city3 = Vail, Colorado }} ==See also== * [[List of jazz radio stations in the United States]] ==References== <div class='references-small'> {{reflist}} </div> ==External links== *{{official website|http://www.kuvo.org}} *{{FM station data|KUVO}} {{Denver Radio}} {{NPR Colorado}} [[Category:Radio stations in Denver, Colorado|UVO]] [[Category:Jazz radio stations in the United States]] [[Category:Albany County, Wyoming]] [[Category:Summit County, Colorado]] [[Category:NPR member stations]] [[Category:Five Points, Denver]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 1985]] {{Colorado-radio-station-stub}}
